intro: Alyxia scortechinii, commonly known as the Florida alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Alyxia scortechinii thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and swamps. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
